required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Learning From Our Patients, Learning From Our Practice: Implementing an Intervention to Support Patients on Dialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Learning From Our Patients, Learning From Our Practice: Implementing an Intervention to Support Patients on Dialysis

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to gather preliminary estimates of the impact of using Capacity Coaching as an intervention for patients receiving dialysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Illness Intrusiveness Score at Baseline, 3 Months, 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: The extent to which a person's illness and treatment impact their life. The Illness Intrusiveness Score ranges from 13-91, with a higher score indicating worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to the Capacity Coaching arm will receive three months of coaching with a Health and Wellness coach. They will receive one one-hour session and five half-hour sessions approximately two weeks apart.
Participants randomized to the No Capacity Coaching arm will receive usual care.

intervention.description: Capacity Coaching focuses on developing the capacity within patients to adapt, endure, and function optimally in their lives along with illness and treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clinician Participants:
- Clinicians employed at Mayo Clinic who provide care to patients visiting the Mayo Clinic - Department of Nephrology and Hypertension Dialysis Services.
Patient Participants:
- Adult patients (18 years of age and older).
- Receive long-term dialysis treatment and services at Mayo Clinic.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Minors (under the age of 18 years).
- Non-English speaking.
- Lack the ability to provide informed consent.
